title: Truett Hurst 2016 The One Armed Man Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A Zin-based blend that offers the variety's friendly personality, this has seasonings of smoked oak and leather with maximum-level ripeness that presents as syrupy and sweet. Dark chocolate, blackberry jam and vanilla all figure in.

title: Twisted River 2017 Late Harvest Bin 568 Riesling (Mosel)
description: While the nose is intensely earthy, suggesting savory notes of dried herbs and pollen, the palate here offers juicy lemon and grapefruit flavors. Medium-sweet on the palate, it's balanced crisply by vivacious lime acidity. Drink now.

title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This is a soft rosé, smoothly textured and approachable. It has layers of rich strawberries as well as touches of red currant attractively wrapped in ripe acidity. The bottling is ready to drink.

title: Viejo Isaias 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Herbal berry and plum aromas are savory and a touch green. An edgy palate pulls back and is drawing, while this tastes of herbal berry fruits and cured meat. Mouthcoating tannins take elegance away from the finish.

title: Vranken NV Demoiselle Tête de Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)
description: A lower dosage than in the past allows the fruit of this wine to shine. With crisp acidity and delicious creamed-apple flavors, it is a balanced wine, zesty and fresh. The bottling could age a little and will be better from 2019.

title: Wakefield 2016 Jaraman Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This Pinot offers up aromas of blueberry, red berry, cocoa and plenty of spicy oak, which lead into a palate that's less plush than the nose. There's a good lick of acidity and rather hard, stalky tannins.

title: Waterbrook 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cocoa, herb, dark chocolate, vanilla and cherry aromas are out front. Fruit and barrel flavors play off each other and continue to intertwine through the finish. Grippy tannins back it up.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Maria di Brun  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals toasted oak, scorched earth and a hint of spearmint. The assertive palate delivers coconut, sour cherry and espresso alongside grainy, astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas evoking toasted oak and mocha slowly appear in the glass. The tight assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and licorice alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: De Bortoli NV DB Family Selection Brut  (Australia)
description: This is a straightforward bubbly that's fruity and crisp in feel, with a slightly slippery texture. It ticks all the boxes.

title: Schmitt Söhne 2017 Relax Riesling (Mosel)
description: Whiffs of saffron and pollen lend a savory tone to this medium-sweet wine. It's easy-drinking yet vibrant, with notes of orange peel, lemon and dusty minerality. Racy acidity offers levity on the finish.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2017 Bridão Clássico Branco White (Tejo)
description: A typical local blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, the wine has rich green-plum flavors while also having balance. It is a fruity wine that is round, full, with plenty of freshness and acidity. Drink this bright wine now.

title: Anonymous 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon work well together in this blend, which also contains Petite Sirah, Malbec and Zinfandel. Reduced and concentrated, there's a moderate richness and rounded quality to the palate, dotted in red plum and cinnamon.

title: Areté 2016 Brut Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine offers a rusty yellow gold, with scents of bruised apple. It seemed much older than its vintage, partially oxidized, but with plenty of fruit. A metallic note crept into the finish. Just one bottle was provided, so no chance to retaste.

title: Bellangelo 2015 Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)
description: Shy aromas of citrus and toast carry to the weighty palate. This is well balanced in feel, with bright acidity carrying the flavors along, yet straightforward in nature.

title: Bodegas Fos 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Scratchy aromas of spicy red fruits and tree bark hold up to scrutiny, as do the oaky notes that create a vanilla essence to go with gamy berry flavors. A chewy, meaty finish belies this Crianza's low price tag.

title: Butternut 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A rusty shade of pink in the glass, this bottling starts with slightly sour aromas of raspberry, strawberry and iron. The palate is a little muddy with dried plum and rusty earth flavors.

title: Campo Viejo 2016  Rioja
description: Gritty plum and raspberry aromas suggest asphalt. In the mouth, this is mild, fresh and highly basic in structure and feel. Plum and raspberry aromas are floral, while this is fleshy on a simple finish.

title: Cedergreen Cellars 2016 Gamay Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Examples of this variety are an extreme rarity in the state, with this one coming from Skyline Vineyard. Aromas of raspberry jam, spice and campfire lead to plentiful mesquite and red fruit flavors. Smoky notes linger on the finish.

title: Colosi 2016 Rosso Red (Salina)
description: A blend of Nerello Cappuccio and Nerello Mascalese, this has subtle aromas suggesting red berry, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers crushed raspberry and a hint of star anise alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.
